TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed TableRowSection extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies where a object is placed in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRowSection> enumeration specifies whether a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> object is placed in the body, header, or footer of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRowSection> enumeration represents the possible values for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.TableSection%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRowSection> enumeration enables you to build accessible Web sites using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control by adding the `thead`, `tbody`, and `tfoot` elements to the HTML that is rendered to the client. If all rows in a table are in the `tbody` element, the section information is not rendered. At least one row must be in a non-body element.
When using the declarative syntax, the sections must be in the following order: header, body, and then footer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRowSection TableBody = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The is placed in the body of the .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRowSection TableFooter = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The is placed in the footer of the .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRowSection TableHeader = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The is placed in the header of the .
